question: Have chimeric antigen receptor (CAR)-T cell therapies been approved for the treatment of B cell malignancies?
ideal_answer: Yes, four chimeric antigen receptor (CAR)-T cell therapies now approved for the treatment of B cell malignancies.

snippets.text: Engineered T cells have achieved success in the treatment of blood cancers, with four chimeric antigen receptor (CAR)-T cell therapies now approved for the treatment of B cell malignancies based on their unprecedented efficacy in clinical trials.
